questions.question: He had a …………….. interest in arts.
questions.description: Lasting interest means interest that lasts.

questions.question: He owed his success …………………… to hard work.
questions.description: Largely is an adverb. We need an adverb to modify the verb owed.

questions.question: He was ………………………… to see his brother again.
He was not ……………………… in the way he handled the interview.
questions.description:
Judicious means sensible.
Judicial refers to an official decision made by a court.

questions.question: The lawyers awaited the ………………………. decision of the Supreme Court.
questions.description: Judicial refers to an official decision made by a court.

questions.question: The citizens’ lobby was ……………………….. in changing the election laws.
questions.description: We need an adjective to complete the verb of incomplete predication here.

questions.question: It was an ………………………… article.
questions.description: We need an adjective here to modify the noun article.

questions.question: The student showed ………………………. in solving the difficult math problem.
questions.description: We need a noun here. Ingenuous and ingenious are adjectives.

questions.question: The large ………………………. made him quite wealthy.
questions.description: We need a noun here because the adjective large modifies a noun.

questions.question: The ………………………. boys jumped into the pond fully clothed.
questions.description: We need an adjective to modify the noun boys.
